newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian call money market dull on reporting day.
newsitem.headline: Indian call money market dull on reporting day.

text.p: Indian call money was quoted 0.10-0.50 percent in an inactive market on the reporting Friday, dealers said.
Banks do not normally borrow on the reporting day as this would increase their reserve requirements for the next reporting fortnight, they said.
Dealers said they expected call money rates to firm up in the next fortnight starting Saturday.

Fund outflows are expected from banks on account of advance tax payments by corporates which have to be made before September 15. "These should push up call money rates," a dealer at a foreign bank said.
